heading: What is Vedic Meditation?
intro: Vedic meditation is one of the oldest and most effortless forms of meditation in the world — a practice that predates the written word and has been passed from teacher to student for thousands of years.
paragraphs: Unlike mindfulness or breath-based practices, Vedic meditation requires no concentration, no control of the mind, and no effort to clear your thoughts. The mind is given a simple tool — a mantra — and allowed to settle naturally, like sediment falling through water.

Practised for 20 minutes, twice daily, sitting comfortably with eyes closed, Vedic meditation allows the nervous system to reach a state of rest that is deeper than sleep. Over time, this releases accumulated stress and leaves you feeling clearer, calmer, and more present.
